TestItem.Stem: According to paragraph 1, what was Mischel's position in the book he published in 1968?

Distractor_list.Distractor: It is impossible to predict whether someone who scored high on a given personality trait, such as generosity, would continue to score high on that trait in the future.
The way a person behaves in a given situation is not determined primarily by personality traits that person has.
Most of the research done in the 40 years before the book was published had overestimated the influence of situations on how people behaved.
The correlation between any two personality traits is too low to provide support for the common view that people's personalities are generally consistent.
